cleaned_text: How To Effectively Treat Irregular Periods With Homeopathy? Menstruation is a healthy experience of a woman's life, and it must come habitually every 28 days, for a period of 3-4 days without coagulating, and the blood loss should correspond to about a quarter of a cup. For a woman, menstrual cycle is a virtuous indicator of her overall wellbeing. Some women get [irregular periods](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/irregular-periods) that appear at longer intervals, an unpredictable discrepancy in the duration of the cycle and the normal twenty-eight day cycle is missing. Some women have very insignificant problems with menstrual cycles, while others experience a monthly torture. Irregular menses is typical in early puberty and not generally perturbing. Women should be alarmed when periods are spaced out for more than two months, as this may suggest [hormonal imbalance](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/hormonal-imbalance) and ovulation problems. A woman's customary hormonal cycle is contingent upon a subtle equilibrium between different hormones. Several potential triggers can stimulate hormonal imbalance leading to irregular menses. If a woman fails to ovulate, her ovaries will not receive a signal to produce a hormone called [progesterone](https://www.lybrate.com/medicine/progesterone). Progesterone is essential in regulating the Uterine lining called [endometrium](https://www.lybrate.com/lab-test/culture-and-sensitivity-endometrium/health-feed), which is discarded during menstruation. Without progesterone, the endometrium persistently grows until it starts to break down and is disposed off as a very heavy [uterine bleeding](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/uterine-bleeding). The endometrium may also shed partially and intermittently, and [bleeding](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/bleeding) becomes irregular or prolonged. Causes of Irregular Menses: - Puberty. - - - Poor [diet](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/healthy-diet)due to [anorexia](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/anorexia), [bulimia](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/bulimia)can influence your hormones. - Excessive [weight loss](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/weight-loss)or gain. - Intense exercise. - Breast-feeding. - - - - Excessive production of Androgen (a steroid hormone such as testosterone that controls the development and maintenance of masculine characteristics). - [Uterine fibroids](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/uterine-fibroids), [cysts](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/cysts), polyps. - [Polycystic](https://www.lybrate.com/lab-test/polycystic-ovarian-disease-panel/health-feed)Ovarian Syndrome (in this condition the ovary does not make all the hormones needed for any egg to mature fully, due to which some follicles remain as cysts, ovulation does not occur and the hormone progesterone is not made. Without progesterone a woman's menstrual cycle is irregular or absent). - [Endometriosis](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/endometriosis)(this is a condition where cells similar to those found inside the uterus grow and are attached outside the uterus forming [implants](https://www.lybrate.com/doctors-for-implants). This can lead to [infertility](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/infertility)and irregular menses). - Pelvic [infection](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/infection). - - - Thyroid disease. - Symptoms of Irregular Menses: - Inconsistency in the length of menstrual cycle. - Acne. - - Low energy levels. - Sore breasts. - - Chills. - Changes in sexual desire. - Infertility. - - - Uterine [cancer](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/cancer). - [Endometrial Hyperplasia](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/endometrial-hyperplasia)(excessive cell growth in the inner lining of the uterus due to excessive estrogen production as a result of delayed ovulation).
